test_cases.objective: To ensure the EMS continuously monitors temperature in GMP storage areas as per URS-EMS-001.

test_steps.action: Set up the EMS to monitor a GMP storage area.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays real-time temperature readings.

test_steps.action: Verify temperature readings are recorded every 5 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature data is logged at intervals not exceeding 5 minutes.

acceptance_criteria: EMS continuously monitors temperature
Temperature readings logged every 5 minutes
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be accurate and complete

test_cases.objective: To confirm the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint as per URS-EMS-005.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS accepts the setpoint and displays it.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation to 27°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates an alert for the deviation.

acceptance_criteria: EMS generates alerts for temperature deviations
Alerts are generated within 30 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Alerts must be accurate and timely

test_cases.objective: Verify the system accurately measures and records temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set up the reference thermometer in the same environment as the EMS sensor.
test_steps.expected_result: Reference thermometer displays stable temperature reading.

test_steps.action: Compare the EMS temperature reading with the reference thermometer at three points: -80°C, 25°C, and 50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer at all test points.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer
System records all test data without errors
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for electronic records
data_integrity_requirements: All test data must be stored in the vendor's standard database format
No manual data entry allowed during testing

test_cases.objective: Verify the system correctly triggers alarm notifications and integrates with the site paging system when temperature deviations occur.
prerequisites: System fully configured with alarm thresholds
Site paging system available for testing

test_steps.action: Set the temperature alarm threshold to 25°C with ±2°C deviation limits.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and saves the alarm configuration.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature rise to 27.1°C in the test chamber.
test_steps.expected_result: System triggers alarm within 30 seconds and sends notification to paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm must trigger within 30 seconds of deviation
Notification must be received by the paging system
Audit trail records the alarm event
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm events must be recorded in the audit trail

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 5°C in the system configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 7.1°C (exceeding +2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 2.9°C (exceeding -2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated for both upper and lower threshold breaches
Alarms occur within 30 seconds of deviation
Alert messages contain correct temperature values
data_integrity_requirements: Alert records must include timestamp and measured value
Alarm events must be recorded in audit trail

test_cases.objective: Verify successful integration between EMS and facility management system using standard protocols.
prerequisites: Both systems are installed and operational
Network connectivity between systems is established

test_steps.action: Configure the EMS to send test data to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: Configuration is accepted without errors.

test_steps.action: Generate a test alarm condition in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification appears in facility management system within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Verify data synchronization between systems for a 24-hour period.
test_steps.expected_result: All temperature readings match between systems with no data loss.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are received within specified timeframe
Data synchronization maintains 100% accuracy
No unplanned system interruptions occur during integration
data_integrity_requirements: All transmitted data must maintain original values

test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS integrates correctly with the existing facility management system using standard protocols.

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to interface with the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully connects to the facility management system.

test_steps.action: Send a test data packet from EMS to the facility management system.
test_steps.expected_result: Data packet is received and processed by the facility management system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS successfully integrates with the facility management system.
Data packets are correctly processed.

test_cases.test_name: Alarm Notification Integration with Paging System
test_cases.objective: To verify that alarm notifications from EMS integrate correctly with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Configure EMS to send alarm notifications to the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS successfully connects to the site paging system.

test_steps.action: Trigger a test alarm in EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is received by the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: EMS successfully integrates with the site paging system.
Alarm notifications are correctly received.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately monitors temperature within the specified range and accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to -80°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The system displays a temperature reading of -80°C ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to +50°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The system displays a temperature reading of +50°C ±0.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: Temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the setpoint
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be stored in vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: To verify that alarm notifications from the EMS integrate correctly with the site paging system.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation exceeding ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS generates an alarm and sends a notification to the site paging system.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notification is received by the site paging system within 30 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm data must be stored in vendor's standard database format
